programName: World Debate Stars with the Harvard MUN Team (ICMUN)
description: A Unique and Intensive 2-Weekend Program on developing fundamental skills in argumentation and persuasion in personal and academic life.
about: World Debate Stars with the Harvard MUN Team is a course spread over two weekends and is led by qualified Student Mentors who have gained valuable experience debating through their involvement competing on the collegiate MUN circuit.

schedule.description:
Theme: The Fundamentals of Argumentation
Students will attend a webinar on creating convincing arguments, focusing on rhetorical strategies and selection of evidence for arguments.
Topic 1: Rhetorical Strategies in Debate
Topic 2: The Keystone of an Argument: Evidence

Students will attend a webinar on counterarguments, focusing on anticipating what others might say and effective methods of rebuttal.
Topic 1: Planning for Your Opponent’s Argument
Topic 2: Refute and Rebut: The Core of a Counterargument

Theme: Thinking on Your Feet
Students will attend a webinar on necessary debate skills, focusing on public speaking in debate and ways to capture attention in an argument.
Topic 1: Being a Successful Orator in Debate
Topic 2: All Eyes on Me: Standing Out in an Argument

1 - Students will attend a session on coming up with arguments on the spot, focusing on general frameworks for building an argument and strategies for avoiding getting flustered in a debate.
2 - Mock Debate

description: Dive deeper into the legal system & take a closer look into the specifics of law.
about: This course is an extension of Future Lawyers Level I and allows students to gain a further understanding of the legal system. Level II dives deeper into specific fields of law, such as constitutional, cyber, corporate, and international law, introduces students to the schools of legal philosophy, and takes a closer look at law school and jobs available in the legal system.

schedule.description:
9:00-9:20: Introductions + Icebreakers
9:20-9:50: Lecture: Constitutional Law
9:50 - 10:15: Worksheet: Amendments and the Law
10:15-10:20: Break
10:20-10:50: Lecture: Cyber-Law
10:50-11:15: Cyber Law Worksheet
11:15-11:20: Break
11:20-11:55: Case Study Research Project Introduction
11:55-12:00: Feedback Form and Homework Reminder

09:00-09:15: Icebreakers, Schedule Review
09:15-09:55: Lecture: Corporate Law
09:55 - 10:15: Corporate Law Kahoot
10:15-10:20: Break
10:20-11:00: Lecture: Legal Theory
11:00-11:25: Worksheet: The Minds Behind Legal Philosophy
11:25-11:30: Break
11:30-11:55: Case Study Research Project Check-In and Work Session
11:55-12:00: Feedback Form and Homework Reminder

09:00-09:15: Icebreakers, Schedule Review
09:15-09:55: Lecture: Law School 101
09:55 - 10:15: LSAT Writing Section Activity
10:15-10:20: Break
10:20-11:00: Lecture: Jobs in the Legal System
11:00-11:25: Worksheet: Jobs In Your Community
11:25-11:30: Break
11:30-11:55: Case Study Research Project Check-In
11:55-12:00: Feedback Form and Homework Reminder

09:00-09:15: Icebreakers, Schedule Review
09:15-09:55: Lecture: International Law
09:55 - 10:20: Worksheet: Law Across The Globe
10:20-10:25: Break
10:25-11:25: Final Project Presentations
11:25-11:30: Break
11:30-11:55: Harvard Q&A
11:55-12:00: Final Feedback Form

description: Cultivate your acumen in Python, Artificial Intelligence, and Machine Learning.
about: The Ai and ML Bootcamp is 2-weeks of power-packed skills in Python, Artificial Intelligence, and Machine Learning under the guidance of qualified student mentors. This program allows high school students to learn in-depth about structuring the algorithms and utilizing codes to formulate their own Fake News Detector. Prior experience in Python coding is not required.

schedule.description:
Review of Python Fundamentals
Understanding Data Structures, Function Syntax, and OOP
Goal: Students gain a fundamental grasp of Python programming and will be able to solve simple problems.

Intermediate Python Knowledge
Libraries and Advanced Mechanics: Algorithms, Binary Trees, and Advanced Structures.
Goal: Students will be able to handle non-trivial Python programs utilizing various common libraries like NumPy and Pandas.

Python with ML and AI
Example applications utilizing Python code for ML and AI; Students learn through a project implementing these technologies using Python.
Goal: Students understand how Python fits into common ML and AI projects, preparing them for their own projects.

Python Fake News AI Detection Algorithm Project
Goal: Students will be able to code and complete their own fake news detector using ML and Python principles taught during the course.

description: Use the power of medicine to positively impact human lives.
about: Future Doctors' Program seeks to introduce students to the fundamentals of pre-medical studies. The program covers various topics, including content modules on genetic inheritance, hormones, immunology, and organic chemistry. It also explores case studies on various diseases, poses medical ethics questions, and offers an opportunity to dissect scientific papers. The program aims to prepare students for a career in medicine by providing an overview of the MCAT process, as well as the chance to hear first-hand about the process from qualified student mentors.

schedule.description:
1. Introductions & Icebreakers
2. Program Overview & Final Project Introduction
3. Module: Genetics
4. Genetics Interactive Activity
5. Group Work Time: Disease Preferences

1. Module: Immunology
2. CRISPR Case Study
3. Final Project Group Work
4. How to be Pre-Med + Q&A

1. Introduction to Organic Chemistry
2. ORGO Module 1: Hydrocarbons & Alkanes
3. ORGO Module 2: Alkyl Side Groups & Naming
4. ORGO Module 3: Other Side Groups
5. Final Practice & Wrap Up

1. Presentations
2. Harvard Q&A

programName: Harvard Model Congress Young Leadership Program
description: A life-changing 2-Week Virtual Program for High School Students to Create Impactful Change with Project-Based, Experiential Learning.
about: Harvard Model Congress (HMC) stands as the world’s largest congressional simulation conference, offering high school students an immersive and dynamic experience. With participation open to students from the United States and abroad, HMC presents a unique opportunity to engage in a realistic model congress simulation. The entire event is organized and run by our devoted team of Harvard undergraduates, ensuring a high-quality and impactful experience for all participants.

schedule.description:
Day 1: Problem Solving (Case)
9 AM - 10 AM EST : Problem Solving Framework
10 AM - 11 AM EST: Tackling Cases
11 AM - 12 PM EST: Cases and presentations

Day 2: Negotiation and Conflict Resolution in a Divided World
9 AM - 9:45 AM EST: “Winning as much as you can” activity
9:45 AM - 10:45 AM EST: The 5 Critical Elements of rational negotiation
10:45 AM - 12 PM EST: Rational negotiation in the real world activity

Day 3: Acing Public Speaking
9 AM - 10 AM EST: Workshop: Public Speaking Techniques
10 AM - 11 AM EST: Rhetoric Analysis
11 AM -12 PM EST: Workshop 'Art of Persuasion'

Day 4: • Debate Workshop & Presentations
9 AM - 10 AM EST: Debate Workshop
10 AM - 11 AM EST: Debate Practicum
11 AM - 12 PM EST: Final Presentations and Reflections

programName: Future Lawyers’ Program by Harvard Student Agencies
description: Use the power of  law to bring about a positive change.
about: The Future' Lawyers Program aims to orient students to the field of law. The program covers the due process of law, the many careers in the world of law, the difficult-to-navigate requirements of the application to law school, and much more.

schedule.description:
1. Introductions & Icebreakers
2. Week Overview & Final Project Introduction
3. The US Court System Lecture
4. Activity: Your State Court
5. Federal vs. State Court Divides (Lecture)
6. Brainstorm for Final Project

1. How to Read Cases? (Lecture)
2. Activity: Case-Reading
3. How to Write a Position Paper?
4. Activity: Interactive Thesis Writing
5. Office Hour Style Work Time: Writing a Position Paper for Final Project

1. How to be Pre-Law, Practice LSAT Questions, & Law Field Activity
2. Small Claims State Law (Lecture)
3. Final Edits/Peer Review
4. Slide Deck Building for Final Presentations

1. Student Presentations
2. Activity: Analytical Reasoning
3. Harvard Q&A

description: Get an immersive, hands-on experience of the world of medicine.
about: The Advanced Doctors Program relies on prior knowledge from The Future Doctors (Level I) program to give students the tools to fill the shoes of an emergency room doctor or a triage nurse in patient care. Students will learn about human physiology, the pathologies that affect it, and the tools needed to diagnose and treat those pathologies.

schedule.description:
1. Introduction & Icebreakers
2. Heart and Coronary Artery Disease Lecture
3. Lung Lecture
4. Activity in Small Groups
5. Muscles & ALS Lecture
6. Radiological Scans Examination & Discussion

1. Renal Failure & ESRD Lecture
2. Digestive System & Reports
3. Skin & Basal Cell Carcinoma Lecture
4. Blood Testing Activity

1. Brain Lecture
2. Endocrine System
3. Associated Diseases & SOAP Note Format
4. Final Project Preparation

1. Case Study Walkthrough
2. Present Final Projects
3. Harvard Q&A
